alert.note: Alert for Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 2:17PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following areas... In northwest Colorado, the Elkhead and Park Mountains, Flat Tops and Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus. In west central Colorado, the Central Colorado River Basin and the Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys. * WHEN...Until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. In addition, heavy rainfall over the Grizzly Creek, Lake Christine and Pine Gulch Fire burn areas, amongst others, is possible during the period of the Watch. Residents and travellers near any of these burn areas should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
